intro: Potentilla sylvestris subvar. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring multiple stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive five-lobed appearance, giving it the common name "cinquefoil." This species is often found in woodland edges, rocky soils, and moist meadows, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
